page.title: 06RESWALLIE MAINS FARM
page.content: Reswallie Mains Farm is run by two workers and two dogs. They do not specialise in any specific aspect of{ {FARMING}, but they do have a slight preference for the{ARABLE}side of farming. Crops grown include oil seed rape (sown in Autumn), Spring Barley (sown in March), wheat (early Autumn) and potatoes (April) of which the varieties Maris Piper, Javelin, Pentland Dell and Home Guard are grown. On the farm cattle are fattened and sheep are reared commercially. The{LIFESTYLE}of the workers is very exhausting, as they have to rise at seven and work until the days work is finished. There is not a steady{INCOME}since it depends on the quality and quantity of the crops.
